info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 8 at 2:28AM CDT until June 8 at 5:30AM CDT by NWS Shreveport LA
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Arkansas, including the following counties, Columbia and Lafayette.
* WHEN...Until 530 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 228 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Magnolia, Stamps, Waldo, Lewisville, McNeil, Bradley, Taylor, Emerson, Buckner, Smithland, Macedonia, Bussey, Village, Canfield, Atlanta, Calhoun, Mount Vernon, Cornelius, Horsehead and Lamartine. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING
